Uses of Class
checkersMain.CheckersBoard

Packages that use CheckersBoard
checkersBoard Provides several implementations of the CheckersBoard abstract class with different strengths and weaknesses. 
checkersMain Provides the main classes and interfaces needed to simulate a Checkers game. 
checkersPlayer Provides several implementations of the CheckersPlayerInterface. 
neuralNetwork Provides the basic abstract classes and interfaces for a feed-forward neural network.

Fields in checkersMain declared as CheckersBoard

Methods in checkersMain that return CheckersBoard
abstract  CheckersBoard CheckersBoard.clone()
          Should return a clone of the current CheckersBoard such that equals(CheckersBoard) returns true and their classes are equal.
 CheckersBoard CheckersGameManager.getBoard()
          Returns the current board.
 CheckersBoard CheckersGameManager.getDisplayBoard()
          Returns the board from Player1's perspective.
abstract  CheckersBoard CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int index)
          Assuming it's Player1's turn, it returns the CheckersBoard resulting from the ply at the corresponding index.
abstract  CheckersBoard CheckersBoard.invertCheckersBoard()
          Creates a new board and it switches Player2 and Player1 pieces and up and down directions, effectively allowing it to always be "PLAYER1's turn" and Player1 to always be moving "up" even as play alternates between two players.

static void Benchmark.timeEfficiencyBenchmark(CheckersBoard... boards)

Method parameters in checkersPlayer with type arguments of type CheckersBoard
static void HAL1000.training1(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork, java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves, int gameOutcome, float learningFactor)
          This training goes through each CheckersBoard in the moves list and computes the error based on the value they would be assigned using the getExpectedValue(CheckersBoard board) method.
static void HAL1000.training2(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork, java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves, int gameOutcome, float learningFactor)
          This training goes through each CheckersBoard in the moves list and computes the error depending on the gameOutcome.
static void HAL1000.training3(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork, java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves, int gameOutcome, float learningFactor)
          This training is a combination of training1 and trianing2
static void HAL1000.training4(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork, java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves, int gameOutcome, float learningFactor)
          This is a reduced training2, that just does training for the last board.
